item.title: Internet Soothes The Savage Beasts
item.description:
Instead of resorting to strict discipline, a school in Vail, Arizona, found a simple solution to improve student behavior on their buses: providing Wi-Fi access. Surprisingly, once installed, disruptive behavior vanished, and students became more engaged in their homework. This success story highlights a key point: providing Internet access can effectively address disciplinary issues. While students may engage in various online activities, the core issue of maintaining order is resolved...

item.title: A white paper providing solutions for talent management in the Chinese hospitality industry
item.description:
Florida International University’s Chaplin School of Hospitality & Tourism Management (CSHTM) and its Institute for Hospitality & Tourism Education & Research (IHTER) have published a new resource for HR professionals and hospitality businesses, particularly those working with Chinese markets. The white paper, titled “Managing Growing Pains of China’s Relentless Hotel Development Pipeline,” examines the significant lack of qualified talent within China’s rapidly expanding hotel industry. The paper offers practical solutions such as professional development programs, conflict resolution strategies, and clearly defined career paths to attract and retain skilled employees...
